intro: Arctotis leucanthemoides, commonly known as the white arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are white to pale yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from spring to summer. Arctotis leucanthemoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
